sen.e: Sueto KODAIRA (date of birth and death unknown) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period, and served Suehiro KAKIZAKI as a senior vassal.

sen.j: 小平季遠は津軽半島で生まれ、父が蠣崎季広に仕える重臣だったため、幼い頃から蠣崎季広の側近として仕えた。
sen.e: Sueto KODAIRA was born in the Tsugaru Peninsula, and as his father served Suehiro KAKIZAKI as a senior vassal, he had served Suehiro KAKIZAKI as a close adviser since a very young age.

sen.e: Originally, the Kakizaki clan was under the control of the Ando clan, however, when Suehiro KAKIZAKI went onto become independent from the Ando clan, Sueto KODAIRA made a great contribution to the lord, Suehiro KAKIZAKI.
